docs.lead_paragraph: Over the last two decades, the Croton Shakespeare Festival has presented two dozen of the bard's plays and several non-Shakespearean dramas, comedies and musicals during its two-week summer season. This year's festival opens at 8 P.M. Thursday with a production of ''All's Well That Ends Well.'' ''We are quite proud of the list of people we have sent on,'' said Frederick Blais, the festival's founder and director. Among them are an Emmy Award winner, Peter Strauss of ''Rich Man, Poor Man,'' and Kathy Beller, Jay Sanders and Ellen Parker, who have appeared on Broadway, in films and on television. Others include Jonathan Miller, who chose the technical side and works with Robert Brustein at Harvard's Loeb Theater; Steven Zuckerman, who directed ''Nuts'' Off Broadway, and Richard Weinstock, an Off-Broadway composer.
